author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ يا إِلهِي تَرَى ما عَجِزَتْ أَلْسُنُ ما سِوَاكَ عَنْ ذِكْرِهِ، وَتَشْهَدُ ما تَكَلْكَلَ عَن بَيانِهِ غَيْرُكَ، بِحَيْثُ تَمَوَّجَتْ بُحُورُ الابْتِلآءِ وَتَهَيَّجَتْ أ
translation: Praise be to Thee, O Lord my God! Thou beholdest what the tongue of no one except Thee can utter, and bearest witness unto things which no mouth can recount. The floods of afflictions are let loose, and the winds of Thy judgment have blown, and from the clouds rain down the darts of tests, and the heavens of Thy decree pour forth the arrows of trial.
